alert.note: Alert for Hudspeth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 7:46PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Texas, including the following county, Hudspeth. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Fort Hancock and McNary. Between 0.5 and 1.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Fort Hancock and McNary is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Fort Hancock, Esperanza, Finlay and McNary. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
